reviews.sentence: Peaceful. Over the last 15 years I have stayed in over 25 hotels in downtown Chicago. To be honest I never had a favorite. After my recent stay at the Ritz Carlton I now know my favorite. Thank you to Rosa at the front desk for finding me the best room possible for the rate class that I chose. I was blown away with the view. I also told Rosa I was seeking rest and solace and that was delivered because I had the most peaceful three nights ever in a hotel. One of the things I noticed most about the Chicago Ritz Carlton is the complete gratitude expressed by the hotel staff whenever I gave compliments or tips. The staff went out of their way to make me feel acknowledged and this went a long way because I was in dire need of a little TLC.

Amazing. Arrived late after a very long international flight to be greeted by super efficiency at the front desk and a very welcome upgrade to a suite. The suite was amazing so big I almost got lost. I ordered room service and yes it was pricey but everything was perfect including the service. Had a perfect nights sleep despite jet lag. On check out I was again greeted by welcoming and efficient staff. If you can stretch to this hotel it is worth it. The service is first class.

I arrived at 2 am because of a delay with my flight and they upgraded me for no extra charge to a massive gorgeous suite. The costumer service of this facility is 2nd to none and very inspirational to me to try meet their quality within my personal business. They really go the extra mile for everything1.

Ritz Carlton Chicago Worth the price. Great location in the heart of the loop. While the hotel is the expensive side the atentivemnes of the staff and the comfort of the room make it all worth while. Staff is very friendly. Food is gog and the hotel offers great views of the city.

Excellent but We had a corner lakeview suit expensive but wonderful. Service was perfect both concierge John and Richard were extremely helpful attentive and caring. The frontdesk staff was effective and very kind. Excellent location also. But we regretted the lack of a coffee tea maker as found throughout the US the replacement of the fruit basket which was only there for our arrival and a few other little things served at the evening service such as we have often had in hotels of this category.
Grateful weekend. The view. They made the breakfast buffet look free then charge 420 for fruit only.

Great location Ritz quality small room. I really loved the place at our Conference rate in the low 30s a night. Like all the Ritz property I have stayed at the facility is very nice and enhanced by several floors of shopping on the property great food and high service levels. As usual we had a great bed. Our room was small but we had a nice view of the city. Close to dozens of Trip Advisor rates restaurants and things to do most within a mile and many easily walkable. The L Train is just a few blocks away.

Beautiful water and city views. We were lucky enough to have a room with a double view north side partial city and water view. Gorgeous. You expect perfection with this hotels reputation and pricing expectations were met. Great location if you want to be close to the lakes recreation opportunities and on the north side of downtown. Also quiet area at night just far enough off of the main arteries.

Ritz weekend. This hotel is the best hotel in Chicago. Great location next to Watertower Place great helpful employees wonderful breakfast great getaway. Consierge is first rate with great information and recommendations.

Rejuvenated. So relaxing. So comfortable. So exquisite. Service 10 out of 10. Yea the Ritz might be a little pricey however it is well worth it. Every dollar I spent went to good use. From the lovely lady at the concierge getting me a dinner reservation at Bandara to the the Latino gentleman working late at night at the front desk inviting me back with true sincere. A lovely stay for my husband and I We may have found our new yearly tradition.

Not what it used to be. We have stayed at this property a half dozen times in the last 5 or 6 years. The service was spotty much more so than in the past and inconsistent. The rooms are mediocre for the price point and though I am a Ritz Carlton loyalist will look elsewhere for our next trip.

Seriously. I was being scam by the Ritz. We decided to stay here because I have an association meeting near by and this is where they book me. We decided to extend our stay for our anniversary. After calling to add on our stay and never received an email confirmation. my husband decided to call to check. Somehow the add on dates was cancel and the lady told my husband that it would cost him 3 times more for one night if he still want the additional night. I call back because I am upset that it was not our fault for the price increase. then they told me that they were actually sold out that Saturday night. and it is not even possible. so they have to book our last night in another hotel. I comply because she assured me that there was absolutely no other room. I agreed. still no email confirmation call back the next day. they forgot to book our in between night but have availability on the last night. ask very nicely to have it corrected. They can correct but one of the night they still have price increase. Ok I ask them to reboked. now the lady just sent me 2 separate booking numbers with no attachments call back the next day. still they got the reservation wrong. I demand a manager since the manager was in a meeting the last time. Somehow within 5 min everything was easily fix. no sold out. no price increase. I think what upset me more than anything is that a long the way not only these individuals did not try to fix the mistakes but was being so dishonest to their customers for their mistakes. Either trying to scaming me to pay more or lying to cover the mistakes. I honestly beyond disappointed with what I have experience so far hopefully they do better at their services when we stay.

where is the glitz in the Ritz Carlton. While construction can be blamed for some of the problems at the Ritz Carlton Chicago there seems to be a loss of ambience brought on by new inexperienced staff as well. While I give three stars it is for the remaining loyal staff who maintain the standards guests had come to appreciate when the R C was run by the Four Seasons. The concierge John was wonderful too. I was told because of my Mariot status I would be given a room upgrade only to be given the room I paid for. On top of that I was put on a floor that when you got off the elevator you were overcome by eucalyptus and people coming and going apparently they were using rooms next door as a temporary spa while the spa was being redone. Gone is the lobby bar for now. Deca Restaurant has a limited menu but the food was as always pricey but good. I had wait until construction is complete before coming back and then I had be wary. I am not sure this will ever be like the old R C experience.

SO INCREDIBLY DISAPPOINTING. Deceptive marketing. The hotel is under renovation but no warnings when you book. that is deceptive. This is an expensive hotel with 1 or 2 working elevators no lobby spa on a converted hotel floor. Rooms with cracked dirty marble. Complain you get a very pedestrian half bottle of wine and some fruit in a bowl. Honestly for 5 days its extremely tough to justify what they charge. NO THANK YOU. Staff very very god that is a stand out. 5 star Hotel though. PLEASE. I feel sorry for the staff explaining the substandard facility that still charges what they do. If this review helps one person make a different choice YAHOO. This was an extended busines personal trip and such a disappointment. The staff. Lots that is Chicago one of the best cities in the world. Just stay somewhere else. Its OK to do renovations and I am sure they will be nice but when people are searching for a hotel you should not be able to represent yourself as a 5.

renovation in progress. disappointing experience at the Ritz my old favorite in Chicago. The hotel is undergoing a complete renovation with some bizarre results. in the room the decor can best be described as minimalist bachelor pad from the 80s. The most egregious example is a massive mirrored sliding door for the bathroom that had sagged and was running into the floor so that the door could only be closed halfway. I did not report this because I would have had to change rooms the door weighs over a hundred pounds and this would not be a ten minute fix. I have always enjoyed taking a bath after a long run in the Ritzs full size bathtubs. Well the renovation has left me with a mini tub much shorter than standard and so no baths. If you install a bathtub make it full size otherwise just delete it. Finally they removed the privacy door to the toilet so if there are two in the room taking a dump has to be done in full view of the other occupant therefore only one person can use the bathroom at a time. First world problem I know but these are first world prices. The people are fantastic as always and the service is the best. I was a student at Northwestern when this place opened so I have a fondness for this hotel.

A superior hotel with great location. Just half a block from the Watertower the Ritz Carlton is a luxury hotel towards the Northern edge of the Magnificent Mile. There is a drive through entrance under the building a street level providing a weatherproof arrival and departure location for cars. You take an elevator to the lobby several floors up which is a wonderful security feature. At the lobby level there is a great lounge which also serves as the hotel bar and next to it a restaurant. This is a more informal restaurant than those you find at most other Ritz Carltons but it will do for a quick business meal. The rooms are spacious well appointed with all the amenities a business traveler might need. Service is friendly and attentive. You pay for the location level of service and the brand but it is worth it.
An amazing hotel. Great staff. Awesome food. Only disappointment was how expensive everything is but then again. it ’s down town. Very convenient place to be and the view was outstanding.

Nice Hotel. Too Bad we visited during the Hotel Strike. Room and view are great. Bed is comfortable and the hotel is really nice. The biggest issue was the fact that the hotel workers were on strike. While the hotel tried to maintain normal service there was very little operable during our stay. We had no idea about this prior to checking in and had to reschedule multiple meetings that we had scheduled in the hotel restaurant which was running on a limited basis. No Room service was offered housekeeping was minimal at best. The part that bothers me is that nothing was done to compensate for the lack of service and the rate stayed the same regardless. Not sure why nothing was done here.
Comfortable stay but overpriced and nothing extravagant about the hotel. Comfortable room. Charges for everything Inc WiFi not 5 star quality I think people stay for the name.

The Ritz will deliver exactly what you expect. Service will be timely and polite. The drinks will be traditional and well made and the food will be unchalenging good and expensive. The Ritz provides an experience that your parents would recognize and enjoy. This is a Chicago staple they will not disappoint or suprise. Enjoy it for what it is or venture out and sample the wide variety of other options Chicago offers.
